MRS talks about wishes MRT talks about costs how should she choose Microeconomics has a concept called the Marginal Rate of Transformation MRT It s defined as given limited resources how much of another must you give up to gain more Of something else In other words è®¦ this you have to give up that iyou want more you have to lose less suddenly thought of this concept while reading a romance novel with a system binding her to the male lead The female lead is bound to a Conquerthe Male Lead System She has a fixed amount Of daily task points like a resource budget that she can freely allocate The system provides several task options each with different costs and rewards She has tWo options Side Quest AJ Skill Training Read for 3 hours Female lead gains 10 independent growth points Side Quest B Intimate Interaction Late night umbrella delivery forehead to forehead contact for 30 seconds lead s affection 20 Insufficient task points only one can be completed She hesitated The system Please select a task path She began to calculate in her mind If choose B my favorability will increase quickly but won t be able to increase my growth value today If choose A i seems like I m taking a steady approach but the male lead s progress willfall behind At this moment she wasn t making an emotional choice but rather a Marginal Rate of Change MRT calculation How much growth value willing to sacrifice to gain 1 more unit af favorability Is this exchange ratio worthwhile She chose to give him the umbrella After completing the task the male lead took the umbrella with a dark face but gently touched the top of her head Favorability 20 the system notification sounded But that day she failed to complete her self upgradeand missed the something

thrilling experience on the Kuala Lumpur happened on Christmas Eve December 24 2025 I m only just remembering to post this now so more friends can bealerted remember reading to the end the last part Was really scary That day three friends and Went to celebrate Christmas Eve near KLCC After the celebration around 8 30 pm we took the LRT back to school We were on a train Without women only carriages SO We randomly entered one It was crowded and there were no seats left so we huddled togetherin a small circle holding onto the middle rail At that moment saw a foreign worker looked like he was Bangladeshi standing diagonally opposite me We made eye contact about three times At first thought hmm maybe it s normal to make eye contact When we re diagonally opposite each other But then my friend standing next to me suddenly said Don tyou think its scary to have someone wearing black clothes in the carriage She said she felt the foreign worker staring at her and she kept making eye contact with him At that point We realized something Was wrong At the next stop people started getting Off one after another and there were tWo empty seats One of my friends and ran to those two seats by this time my seat was in the same row as the foreign worker no longer diagonally opposite him while my other two friends continued to stand in the same place diagonally opposite the foreign worker After sat pretended to look in the direction of the foreign worker and found that he really Was staring at my friend After a While he turned his head and looked at us and made eye contact with again At that point We were about four or five stops away something

Kelana LRT malfunction The Kelana Jaya Line experienced another malfunction during rush hour leaving many commuters stranded at stations and disrupted This is not the first time the line has malfunctioned at a critical time the relevant authorities have been slow to resolve the issue Which is disappointing Each time the system malfunctions the Ministry Of Transport s response is identical social media notifications public apologies and suggestions to passengers to use alternative modes of transport However this mechanical approach fails to truly alleviate the inconvenience to the public Public transport disruptions are notjust about time delays severely disrupt work study and daily life As one of the busiest light rail lines the Kelana Jaya Line carries millions of passengers daily including commuters students and the elderly When the system malfunctions the impact is far reaching commuters are late or forced to take time Off work students miss classes and exams and the elderly are unable to access medical care on time affecting their treatment Using alternative transport seems like a solution but it s not feasible for many passengers Ride services are overwhelmed during peak hours with prices soaring making them unaffordable for many even è®¦ people are willing to pay they may not be able to hail a ride Transport Minister Anthony Loke visited Singapore to learn from its efficient MRT operation Singapore s success lies in its strict implementation of regular maintenance and proactive upkeep Does Malaysia s LRT system have a similar mechanism preventative maintenance and rapid response plans Is there a long term plan to comprehensively improve the quality of public transport In contrast Malaysia rushes to repair after accidents but lacks transparenqy and accountability afterwards with no accountability something hailing

century old historical building flagship store Kaw Kaw Builtin 1887 i Wasan important administrative building during the British colonial period The most iconic feature of this building is its central clock tower knownas Kuala Lumpur s Big Ben and it s one of Kuala Lumpur s representative historical landmarks Renovated and reopened it s free to visit in February and there are great photo spots everywhere every shot is a masterpiece no editing required For lunch We chose Kaw Kaw Malaya which had a queue Upon entering you see a mural of the Father of the Nation this is a brand store under Bungkus Kaw Kaw There s also a corner selling various cultural and creative products and souvenirs each with a strong Malaysian flavor The menu has been upgraded with many choices especially the Giant Nasi Lemak Dulang Which is enough for 5 7 people Next time invite friends to try this delicious food at Malaysia Records Enjoying delicious food while admiring the beautiful scenery Was truly a pleasure Next time come back at 6 pmand wait for nightfall The lights will make the Moorish style buildings even more dazzling creating a different kind of beauty Bangunan Sultan Abdul Samad opposite Merdeka Square Ampang Line or Sri Petaling Line Masjid Jamek turn left and walk straight across the bridge It s abouta 5 minute Walk use an umbrella i you re worried about the sun Chinatown 10 minute walk You can go to Plaza Dataran Merdeka Parking KawKawMalayaByBungkusKawKaw BungkusKawKaw DataranMerdeka MalaysianlocalFood MerdekaSquare BangunanSultanAbdulsamad MalaysiaTourism Malaysiacheckln days agoin Malaysia something Malaya
